attributes.comment:
While we understand the necessity of recouping expenses incurred for the
processing of essential information, a 66% increase in fees over one year seems
excessive. With the economies of shared information services, one would expect
the price would actually decrease as the process becomes more automated and
requires less human intervention. We don't mind paying for what is needed, but
are confused why the process seems to be taking longer, getting more complicated
and expensive instead of the reverse.

We are adopting our second child internationally. Not only did we have to
replicate and pay for the entire I-600 A application process a second time with
identical information, but it is possible that we will have to do a third time
since our I-171 status could potentially expire before our adoption is
processed. This seems inefficient.

Couldn't the same data can be reused-- expediting the process and reducing the
expense? Perhaps there should be an exemption for international adoptions-- the
expense of which is already excessive and presents a hardship to many otherwise
well-intentioned families who only want to give a child a safe home.

Thanks for your consideration.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Stefanie Sirc
